meanings.definition: To focus or concentrate on something beforehand.
meanings.sent1: Before the big test, she prefocussed on studying all the key concepts.
meanings.sent2: He always prefocussed on his goals before starting any new project.
meanings.sent3: The cat prefocussed on the mouse, ready to pounce at any moment.
meanings.sent4: Her mind prefocussed on the upcoming presentation, blocking out all distractions.
meanings.sent5: Prefocussed like a laser beam, she tackled the problem with precision.

meanings.definition: Having already focused or concentrated on something.
meanings.sent1: The prefocussed student aced the exam effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: She wore a prefocussed expression, indicating she was fully prepared.
meanings.sent3: The prefocussed squirrel gathered all the nuts before winter.
meanings.sent4: His prefocussed mind was always one step ahead of the competition.
meanings.sent5: The prefocussed athlete visualized the finish line, pushing himself to the limit.
